edu.cmu.sei.arche.corebridge
Interface IRefreshableUI

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArchEUIPlugin
public interface IRefreshableUI

One class in the user interface layer should implement this interface so that the data elements can properly indicate when views have to be refreshed.

Author:
Paulo Merson

Method Summary
 void flagViewsToRefresh(java.lang.Class clazz)
          Take some action to register the fact that an object of the given class was created, deleted or modified and views that display that kind of object should be refreshed.
 void refreshViews()
          Take the proper actions to refresh all views that were flagged by calling flagViewsToRefresh().
 

Method Detail

flagViewsToRefresh

public void flagViewsToRefresh(java.lang.Class clazz)
Take some action to register the fact that an object of the given class was created, deleted or modified and views that display that kind of object should be refreshed. The method only flag that one or more views need to be refreshed (by setting bits in a bitmap for example), but it doesn't refresh the views. In the VO classes, this method must be called in the constructor and in each setter method that changes a value that corresponds to a slot in the core.

Parameters:
clazz - an oject of this class has changed.

refreshViews

public void refreshViews()
Take the proper actions to refresh all views that were flagged by calling flagViewsToRefresh(). Then reset the data element (e.g. a bitmap) used to indicate a view is flagged to be refreshed.
